meanings.definition: Work, usually of a low quality, done quickly and without much effort.
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting was just hackwork, lacking any real skill or creativity.
meanings.sent2: The company hired someone to do the hackwork of assembling the products on the production line.
meanings.sent3: The hackwork of the student's essay made the teacher chuckle at its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: The building's facade was a mere hackwork of architectural design, lacking any elegance.
meanings.sent5: The hackwork of the chef's dish left much to be desired in terms of taste and presentation.

meanings.definition: To produce work quickly and without much effort, often of low quality.
meanings.sent1: She decided to hackwork her way through the project, just to get it done on time.
meanings.sent2: The writer had to hackwork several articles to meet the deadline for the magazine.
meanings.sent3: He hackworked his way through the presentation, hoping no one would notice the lack of preparation.
meanings.sent4: The team had to hackwork a solution to the problem, even though it was not the most effective approach.
meanings.sent5: Despite the rush, she refused to hackwork the design, preferring to take her time and do it right.
